rl.sqltrainer.persistence

Class DBConnectionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • rl.sqltrainer.persistence.DBConnectionHandler

  • public class DBConnectionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Class, responsible for communication with a database using JDBC. It maintains connection data and provides a method to execute a query.
    Author:
    Ruediger Lunde

    • Field Summary

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> executeStatement(java.lang.String statement)
      Connects to the database, executes the specified SQL query, and returns the result in nested list of strings.
      java.lang.String[] getConnectionData()
      Returns server name, database name, user name, and password.

      Modifies the connection data settings.

      Changes JDBC driver settings.

      • setJdbcDriverData

        public void setJdbcDriverData(java.lang.String driver,
                     java.lang.String protocol)
        Changes JDBC driver settings.
        Parameters:
        driver - Class name of the JDBC driver to be used.
        protocol - Name of the vendor specific JDBC sub protocol to be used.

      • setConnectionData

        public void setConnectionData(java.lang.String server,
                     java.lang.String db,

        Modifies the connection data settings.

      • getConnectionData

        public java.lang.String[] getConnectionData()
        Returns server name, database name, user name, and password.

      • executeStatement

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> executeStatement(java.lang.String statement)
                                                                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                                         java.sql.SQLException
        Connects to the database, executes the specified SQL query, and returns the result in nested list of strings. Note that exception handling is not included. It is delegated to the caller.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
